result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy R. Schlegel

records.addlTxt:
AMENDED

$250 on file

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Amy S. and Jeremy S. The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- Not to possess firearms.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

9:04 AM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Melstrom, Clk: K. Anderson, Attorney Holly Rockow in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Nicholas M Zimmerman in court for Timothy R. Schlegel. Defendant Timothy R. Schlegel in court. DE confirms address. Atty. Zimmerman requests bond modification. ADA Rockow objects. Court modifies bond and sets PSC. Adjourned. kma
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Filed by Atty Zimmerman. arc   to ty
Filed by Atty Zimmerman. sm
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Settlement conference on September 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Amy S. and Jeremy S. The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and random ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

- Not to possess firearms.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

9:52 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: S. Fox, Defendant Timothy R. Schlegel in court.  Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nicholas M Zimmerman in court for Timothy R. Schlegel. The State does not take a position on the request for bond modification requested by the victim. Victim makes statements to the Court. Atty Zimmerman reviews status of Def and argument to amend bond. Court amends bond to no abusive contact. Court preserves Prelim Hearing rights. Court schedules Scheduling Conference with the DA's office for September 7, 2022 at 2:00 pm. Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Settlement conference on July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on July 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Amy S. and Jeremy S. or the residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and random ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

- Not to possess firearms.

- May retrieve belongings at residence ONE TIME in the presence of law enforcement.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:55 PM  CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, ADA: Brian Thomas Smestad and Intern Connor Smith,  DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson for today, DF:  Timothy R. Schlegel appeared from jail. DE does not qualify for public defender, DE states that he wishes to retain private counsel. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. State requests bond. Court orders bond. Court sets STC for attorney status, SETC and PSC. Adjourned: 2:04 PM. kma  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Settlement conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
